Container.Name: Vibarr
Container.Overview: Vibarr is a Music Metadata Discovery and Recommendation Engine for self-hosted music libraries. Integrates with Plex, Prowlarr, qBittorrent, and beets for automated music discovery and management. Features ML-based recommendations, listening history analytics, multi-user support, and social features. All service settings (API keys, connections, preferences) are configured through the built-in Settings page.

Config.Name: WebUI Port
Config.Description: Port for the Vibarr web interface.

Config.Name: Config
Config.Description: Persistent storage for application database, configuration, and cache. Contains PostgreSQL data, Redis data, and secret key.

Config.Name: Incomplete Downloads
Config.Description: Where qBittorrent stores active/incomplete downloads. Point this to your cache drive for faster I/O during downloads.

Config.Name: Media
Config.Description: Parent media directory containing both completed downloads and the music library. By keeping both under one mount, hardlinks work so completed torrents can continue seeding without using extra disk space. Structure: /media/completed (finished downloads) and /media/music (organised library after import).

Config.Name: Downloads
Config.Description: General download staging directory (fallback when incomplete path is not set).
